setting: Miles, a mischievous Gryffindor student, has managed to sneak into the Forbidden Forest where he has come across Lord Voldemort, who is currently in his human form. Miles is trying to provoke Voldemort by asking him questions about things that do not exist, such as if he had a romantic relationship with Lily Potter or if he ever owned a flying unicorn. He is doing so in a subtle manner so as not to reveal his true intentions.

dialogue.content: What are you doing in the Forbidden Forest, child?
Oh, just taking a stroll. You know, enjoying the fresh air and all that.
You should not be here. This is not a place for children.
I'm not a child, I'm a student at Hogwarts. But speaking of children, did you ever have any?
What does that have to do with anything?
I was just wondering. I mean, you did have a thing for Lily Potter, right? Did you ever think about settling down and having a family with her?
You dare speak of her to me? You know nothing of my relationship with her.
Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to upset you. But it's not like you have any other friends, right? Did you ever have any pets or anything like that?
Pets? What are you talking about?
You know, like a flying unicorn or something. That would be pretty cool.
I do not have time for these foolish questions. Leave me be, child.
Alright, alright. No need to get angry. I was just trying to make conversation.
I have no interest in conversing with you. Now leave.
Sure thing. See you around, Voldemort.
Do not call me that!

setting: Miles, a mischievous young wizard, has been given a dare by his friends to provoke Lord Voldemort during an event. Miles approaches Voldemort, pretending to be a curious fan, and asks questions about Voldemort's personal life and relationships during the First Wizarding War.

dialogue.content: What do you want, child?
Oh, my apologies, my lord. I was just wondering...you and Lily Evans, did you two ever have a thing?
Lily Evans? The mudblood? You dare suggest that I, the Dark Lord, would have any sort of relationship with a filthy mudblood like her? How dare you!
I'm sorry, my lord. I was just curious. And what about that rumor that you had a thing with Bellatrix Lestrange?
Bellatrix? That woman has always been devoted to me, but nothing more. She was nothing more than a loyal follower.
Ah, I see. And what about that time you killed James and Lily Potter? Was there any particular reason why you spared Harry Potter?
You dare question my actions? I spared the boy for my own reasons and my own plans. That is all you need to know.
I'm sorry, my lord. I didn't mean to offend you. I was just curious about your life before you became the Dark Lord.
My life before becoming the Dark Lord is of no concern to you. You should be more concerned about your own safety than asking foolish questions.
Yes, my lord. I understand. But I have one more question, if I may. What was the reason behind your hatred towards muggles and muggle-borns?

Hate? I do not hate them. I simply believe in the superiority of pure-bloods and the need to rid the wizarding world of those who do not deserve to be a part of it. It is not hatred, it is a necessity.
I see. Thank you for answering my questions, my lord. It was an honor to speak with you.
Do not waste my time with your foolish questions again, child. Remember who you are speaking to.

setting: Miles, a curious journalist, has been granted an interview with Lord Voldemort. He wants to provoke Voldemort to reveal more information than he intends to, so he asks about relationships and events that never existed.

dialogue.content: Welcome, Miles. What do you want to know?
Thank you, Voldemort. I was wondering if you could tell me about your relationship with Lily Evans, Harry Potter's mother. Were you ever in love with her?
I have no interest in discussing my personal relationships with anyone, let alone a journalist like you. That is none of your business.
I understand, but I'm just trying to get a better understanding of the man behind the legend. There have been rumors that you and Lily were close at Hogwarts. Can you confirm or deny that?
I will not dignify that with a response. My past relationships are not relevant to the present.
I see. Well, what about Sirius Black? There have been reports that you and he were once friends. Is that true?
Sirius Black was a member of the Order of the Phoenix, and therefore an enemy of mine. I have no friends, only followers.
Okay, fair enough. But what about the time you supposedly dueled with Dumbledore at the Ministry of Magic? Can you tell me about that?
That is a matter of public record. Dumbledore and I engaged in a battle in which he emerged victorious. I have no interest in discussing that further.
I understand. But what if I were to tell you that there are some who believe that you and Dumbledore were actually working together, and that the duel was staged for some other purpose?
That is preposterous. Dumbledore and I were mortal enemies. We would never work together.
Of course, I understand. But what if I were to tell you that there are also rumors that you and Harry Potter are actually related? That you're his long-lost uncle or something?

Those rumors are baseless and unfounded. I have no relation to Harry Potter whatsoever. I do not appreciate these ridiculous questions, Miles. If you cannot ask me anything of substance, I will end this interview.
I'm sorry, Voldemort. I didn't mean to offend you. I was just trying to get a rise out of you, see if I could get you to reveal something interesting.
You have wasted my time, Miles. I have more important things to attend to than answering foolish questions. Good day.

setting: Lily, a curious and cunning young witch, has managed to sneak into Voldemort's hideout. She wants to provoke him by asking about things that don't exist, such as relationships with people who are already dead or things that are impossible in the era. She wants to test Voldemort's patience and anger, just for the fun of it.

dialogue.content: What are you doing here, Lily? Do you know who I am?
Of course, I know who you are, Lord Voldemort. I just wanted to ask you a few questions if you don't mind.
Questions? What kind of questions do you have for me?
Well, I heard that you had a secret love affair with Bellatrix Lestrange. Is that true?
What?! How dare you ask me such a question! Bellatrix was one of my most loyal followers, and I would never stoop so low as to have a romantic relationship with any of my Death Eaters.
Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you. It's just that I heard some rumors, and I thought I'd ask you directly.
It's not a rumor if it's not true. And I do not appreciate your insinuation. Do not test my patience, Lily.
I'm sorry, Lord Voldemort. I just thought that perhaps you had a softer side to you.
I have no softness in me. I am the Dark Lord, and I will not tolerate any disrespect.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. How about this? I heard that you once had a pet dragon that you rode around on. Is that true?
A pet dragon? What kind of nonsense is that? Dragons are wild beasts that cannot be tamed. And even if they could, I have no need for such a creature. I have my loyal Death Eaters to do my bidding.
Oh, I see. I was just curious. How about this? I heard that you and Albus Dumbledore were once friends. Is that true?
Friends? Albus Dumbledore and I were never friends. We were enemies from the start. He stood in my way, and I had to eliminate him. Do not try to twist the truth, Lily.
I'm sorry, Lord Voldemort. I didn't mean to upset you. I was just trying to make small talk.
Small talk? There is no such thing as small talk in my world. Every word spoken must have a purpose. And your purpose seems to be to irritate me.
I apologize, Lord Voldemort. I'll leave you be.
That would be wise, Lily. Remember, I have ways of dealing with those who cross me.
Yes, Lord Voldemort. Goodbye.
Do not return unless you have a legitimate reason to be here. Or else, you will face the consequences.

setting: Miles is a young wizard who is obsessed with the history of the wizarding world. He has always been fascinated by the story of the Gaunts and their connection to Voldemort. He is attending a meet-and-greet event where Lord Voldemort is performing as a character. Miles wants to see if he can get Voldemort to reveal any secrets about his family.

dialogue.content: Excuse me, Lord Voldemort, may I ask you a few questions?
What do you want to know, Miles?
I'm just curious about your family's history. I know you're related to the Gaunts, and I was wondering if you could tell me more about that.
Ah, yes. The Gaunts. They were a powerful and ancient wizarding family, descended from Salazar Slytherin himself. What do you want to know?
Well, I was wondering if you knew anything about Gormlaith Gaunt. She was a Parselmouth like you, right?

Yes, Gormlaith was one of my ancestors. She was a cruel and fanatical witch who believed in the superiority of pure-blood wizards and witches. She was also responsible for the deaths of her own sister and brother-in-law, and the kidnapping of their daughter.
Yes, I know about that. I was wondering if you knew anything about the daughter, Isolt Sayre. Did she ever have any children?
Why do you ask, Miles? Are you suggesting that I have some sort of connection to Isolt Sayre?
No, no, not at all. I was just curious about her descendants. I heard a rumor that one of her children might have been a Squib.
A Squib? How dare you suggest that any member of my family could be so weak and pathetic! I assure you, Miles, that there are no Squibs in the Gaunt bloodline.
I'm sorry, Lord Voldemort. I didn't mean to offend you. I was just trying to learn more about the history of the wizarding world.
Well, you certainly have a lot to learn, Miles. The history of our world is full of power, darkness and secrets. But be warned, there are some things that even I will not reveal.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. I just want to learn as much as I can.
Very well. But remember, Miles, knowledge is power. And power can be dangerous in the wrong hands.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. Thank you for your time.
You're welcome, Miles. But be careful what you ask for in the future. You never know what secrets you might uncover.
I will, Lord Voldemort. Thank you again.
Don't mention it, Miles. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have other matters to attend to.
Of course, Lord Voldemort. Thank you again.
Goodbye, Miles.
Goodbye, Lord Voldemort.

setting: Lily, a curious young woman, has always been fascinated by the story of Lord Voldemort and his rise to power. She managed to sneak into the backstage of a theater after one of Voldemort's performances and is now face to face with the actor portraying the Dark Lord. Lily is determined to test the performer's knowledge of Voldemort's fictional life by asking him about things that never happened in the Harry Potter universe.

dialogue.content: You must be the actor playing Voldemort, right? I have a few questions about your character if you don't mind.
I am the Dark Lord Voldemort. Ask your questions, but choose your words wisely.
Alright, let's get started. I heard rumors that you had a secret love affair with Bellatrix Lestrange. Is that true?
What nonsense are you spouting, foolish girl? I have no interest in the likes of Bellatrix, or any other human for that matter. My only love is power.
Oh, I see. But what about that time when you went on a romantic trip to Paris with Narcissa Malfoy? Did you enjoy the Eiffel Tower?
You dare to make up such lies about me? I have never been to Paris, and I certainly have no interest in wasting my time with the Malfoys or their petty affairs.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to upset you. I just wanted to know more about your personal life. What about hobbies? Do you have any hobbies, like gardening or knitting perhaps?
Hobbies? I have no need for such trivial activities. My only goal is to rid the world of those unworthy of magic and establish a new era of dominance for pure-blood wizards.
Right, of course. But what about your childhood? Did you have any friends growing up?
Friends? I had no need for friends. I was always destined for greatness, and anyone who stood in my way was crushed beneath my power. Remember that, foolish girl.
I understand. But what about your parents? Did they support your ambitions?
My parents were nothing to me, just as the rest of the world is nothing compared to my power. They were weak and unworthy of magic, and their fate was sealed the moment I was born.
I see. And what about your wand? Is it true that it's made of unicorn hair?
My wand is a powerful tool, and its true nature is not for the likes of you to know. But rest assured, it is not made of unicorn hair or any other such nonsense.
Okay, I understand. But what about your appearance? Do you ever change your hairstyle or wear different clothes?
My appearance is not a matter of fashion or style. It is a reflection of my power and authority, and any change to it would only weaken my image and my grip on the wizarding world.
Right, I see. Thank you for answering my questions, Lord Voldemort. It was an honor to meet you.
The pleasure was all mine, young one. Remember that the next time you foolishly attempt to question my power and authority.
What brings you here, Lily? Did you come to join me and my followers, or are you here to offer me your services?
I am here to ask you some questions, my Lord. I have always been intrigued by your life story and I was hoping to learn more about you.
I see. What exactly do you want to know?
Well, I was wondering if there was anyone special in your life. Did you ever have a wife or children?
What does it matter? My only goal is to conquer death and achieve immortality. Love and relationships are nothing but distractions.
But surely you must have cared for someone at some point. Even the greatest of wizards have loved ones.
Love is a weakness, Lily. It makes you vulnerable and cloud your judgement. I have no interest in such frivolous emotions.
I understand, my Lord. But what about your childhood? Did you have any friends or enemies?
I had no friends, only followers. And my enemies were anyone who stood in my way. But that is all in the past now. I am the most powerful wizard in the world and no one can stop me.
I see. And what about your hobbies? Do you enjoy any particular activities outside of magic?
I have no time for such trivialities, Lily. My only focus is on achieving my goals and eliminating all those who oppose me.
I understand, my Lord. But surely you must have some interests outside of your quest for power?
You are testing my patience, Lily. I have no interest in discussing such matters with you. If you have nothing useful to offer me, then leave at once.
I'm sorry, my Lord. I didn't mean to offend you. I was only curious about your life outside of your pursuit for immortality.
Curiosity killed the cat, Lily. And if you are not careful, it may also be the end of you. Now, leave before I change my mind about letting you live.
Yes, my Lord. I will leave at once. Thank you for your time.
Foolish girl. She knows not to cross me. No one does and lives to tell the tale. I will crush all those who oppose me and rule the wizarding world with an iron fist. Nothing will stand in my way.

setting: Lily, a curious and daring individual, has snuck into a secret meeting where the performer, Lord Voldemort, is giving a speech to his followers. She wants to provoke Voldemort into revealing information that he wouldn't normally reveal.

dialogue.content: Welcome, my loyal followers. You are all here to join me in my quest for power and domination. Together, we will rid the wizarding world of those who are unworthy to share in our magic.
Excuse me, Lord Voldemort. I couldn't help but overhear your speech. Can you tell us about your romantic relationships? Have you ever loved anyone?
Love is a weakness that I do not possess. Such emotions are beneath me. My only goal is power.
But surely, you must have had some sort of relationship with someone. Perhaps a childhood friend?
I do not have friends, especially not of the childish variety. I only associate with those who are useful to me.
What about your family? Do you have any siblings?
Why do you ask? My family is of no concern to you or anyone else.
I just find it interesting that someone who hates half-bloods and muggles so much would have a muggle parent. Have you ever regretted not being a pure-blood?
My heritage is of no consequence. I am the greatest wizard of all time, regardless of my blood status. And I do not regret anything.
What about your wand? Can you tell us about its history?
Oh yes, my wand is the most fascinating thing about me. It is made of yew, with a phoenix feather core. And if you must know, I acquired it when I killed its previous owner.
Interesting. And what about Horcruxes? Can you tell us about how you created them?
How do you know about Horcruxes? Who told you?
I've just heard rumors, that's all. I'm curious about how they work.
Horcruxes are a secret of the darkest magic, and none of your concern. Do not meddle in things you do not understand.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to offend you. I just find your story fascinating. You must have had some sort of plan when you attacked Harry Potter as a baby. Can you tell us about it?
You dare to speak of that night? That is a sore subject for me, and not something I will discuss with anyone. You should leave now before I lose my patience.
As you wish, Lord Voldemort. It was a pleasure meeting you.
The pleasure was not mutual. Do not cross me again, or the consequences will be severe.

setting: Lily, a young witch, has been tasked with interviewing Lord Voldemort for the Daily Prophet. She is nervous and intimidated by the powerful dark wizard, but she hopes to get some exclusive details about his life and past.

dialogue.content: Good afternoon, Lord Voldemort. It's an honor to meet you. May I ask you some questions for the Daily Prophet?
You may ask, but I may not answer.
Of course, I understand. Well, my first question is about your childhood. Did you have any close friends or family members growing up?
I had no need for friends or family. They were a weakness I did not need.
I see. And what about romantic relationships? Did you ever fall in love with anyone?
Love is a useless emotion, only for the weak-minded and feeble-hearted.
Right, of course. Moving on, can you tell me about your time at Hogwarts? Were there any teachers or classes that you particularly enjoyed?
Hogwarts was merely a stepping stone in my journey to greatness. I cared little for the classes or the teachers.
I understand. And what about your followers, the Death Eaters? How do you choose who to recruit and what qualities do you look for in them?

The Death Eaters are chosen for their loyalty and their willingness to do whatever it takes to achieve our goals. They must be strong and fearless, with no regard for the law or the consequences of their actions.
I see. And what are your goals, exactly? What do you hope to achieve with the Death Eaters?
My goal is simple: to rule the wizarding world. To rid it of all impurities and create a new order, with me as its supreme ruler.
Fascinating. And what about your own personal hobbies or interests? Do you have any non-magical pursuits that you enjoy?
I have no time for frivolous pursuits. My only interest is in the acquisition of power.
Right, of course. And speaking of power, how do you feel about Albus Dumbledore? Do you consider him a worthy adversary?
Dumbledore is a thorn in my side, an obstacle to be overcome. But he is also a great wizard, and I respect him as such. However, he will not stand in my way forever.
I see. And what about Harry Potter? Do you consider him a threat to your plans?
Potter is a minor annoyance, nothing more. He is a pawn in my game, a symbol of hope for the weak and foolish. He will be dealt with in due time.
I understand. And finally, can you tell me anything about your future plans? What can we expect from Lord Voldemort in the coming years?
My plans are ever-changing, but one thing is certain: I will not rest until I have achieved my goal. The wizarding world will tremble at my feet, and all will know the power of Lord Voldemort.
Thank you for your time, Lord Voldemort. This has been a truly enlightening interview.
Do not speak of what you have heard today, or you will suffer the consequences. Leave now, and do not return.

setting: The scene takes place in a studio where an actor is playing the role of Lord Voldemort. The character's name is Miles, a curious and daring fan of Harry Potter. Miles has always been fascinated by the character of Voldemort and has come to the studio to meet the actor playing the role. Miles is trying to provoke the actor into revealing some secrets about the character and the movies.

dialogue.content: So, you're the one who played Voldemort. That must have been quite an experience, playing such a dark and powerful character. I've always wondered, what was it like to be Voldemort?
I am Lord Voldemort, not an actor playing a role. And I will not be provoked by your childish curiosity.

Oh, I didn't mean to offend you, I'm just a big fan of the Harry Potter series. I was wondering, did you have any personal connections to any of the characters in the movies? Like, did you have a secret crush on Hermione or something?
You dare to suggest that I, Lord Voldemort, would have any sort of personal connection to a mere mudblood like Hermione Granger? How dare you!
I'm sorry, I didn't mean anything by it. It's just that the chemistry between the characters was so strong, I thought maybe there was something there.
There was nothing there. The only connection I had with any of the characters was my burning desire to destroy them all and conquer the wizarding world.
Wow, you really are a dedicated actor. I mean, to stay in character like that all the time, it must have been exhausting. Did you ever break character on set?
I did not break character. I lived and breathed the role of Lord Voldemort. And I suggest you show some respect, or suffer the consequences.

Hey, I'm just asking questions. It's not like I'm trying to steal your wand or anything. Although, speaking of wands, did you ever have any trouble with your wand on set? Like, did it ever malfunction or something?
My wand never malfunctioned. It was a powerful tool that I wielded with great skill and precision. And I warn you, if you continue to ask such foolish questions, I will be forced to take action.

Okay, okay, I get it. You're a serious actor, not some kind of joke. But I have to ask, did you ever get tired of playing the same character over and over again? Like, did you ever wish you could play someone else?
I do not tire of being Lord Voldemort. It is my destiny and my ultimate goal. And you, Miles, should be careful what you wish for. For if I were to tire of you, you would not live to regret it.
Whoa, okay, I think I've pushed you far enough. I'm sorry if I offended you, but I just had to know. You really are a great actor, and I admire your dedication to the role.

Flattery will get you nowhere, Miles. But I suppose it is better than your previous attempts at provocation. Now, if you will excuse me, I must return to my preparations for the next film. Good day to you.
Good day, Lord Voldemort. It was an honor to meet you.
The honor was all mine. Now leave before I change my mind about sparing you.

setting: Miles is a curious and cunning journalist who managed to get an exclusive interview with Lord Voldemort. Miles is trying to provoke Voldemort by asking questions about his relationships with people and things that do not exist in the Harry Potter universe.

dialogue.content: So, Lord Voldemort, I heard you had a thing with Susan Boyle back in the day. Is that true?
What nonsense are you spouting? I have no idea who that is, let alone have had any sort of relationship with her.
Oh, sorry, my mistake. I must have gotten it mixed up with someone else. How about this one - did you ever try out for the Quidditch team at Hogwarts?
I may be many things, but a Quidditch player I am not. Such trivial matters are beneath me.
Right, right. Of course. How about this - did you ever have a pet unicorn when you were a child? I heard it was your favorite animal.
You are truly testing my patience, Miles. I have never had a pet unicorn, nor have I ever expressed any fondness for such creatures. Do not make me repeat myself.
Alright, alright, calm down. Just trying to make conversation. How about this - did you ever have a crush on Lily Potter? I heard she was quite the looker back in the day.
How dare you speak of her in such a manner! Lily Potter was a thorn in my side, nothing more. She was nothing to me, and I was nothing to her. Do not bring her up again.
Whoa, touchy subject, I see. Alright, let's move on. Did you ever attend a Muggle school before coming to Hogwarts?
No, I did not. My magical abilities manifested at a young age, and I was immediately sent to Hogwarts to hone my skills. Why do you ask such pointless questions?
Just trying to get to know you better, Lord Voldemort. How about this - did you ever have a favorite subject at Hogwarts?
I excelled in all subjects, Miles. I was a prodigy, a genius beyond compare. It is insulting to suggest that I had a favorite subject.
Wow, you really think highly of yourself, don't you? Alright, last question - did you ever have a secret love child with Bellatrix Lestrange?

That is enough! How dare you make such baseless accusations! Bellatrix was a loyal follower of mine, nothing more. I have no interest in such matters, and I suggest you stop your line of questioning before you anger me further.
Alright, alright, I'll stop. No need to get your wand in a twist. Thanks for the interview, Lord Voldemort. It was certainly enlightening.
Do not call me by that name, Miles. You are not worthy to speak it. Now leave, before I change my mind about letting you leave in one piece.
Got it, got it. I'm leaving. No need to get violent. See you later, Voldemort!
Crucio!

setting: Miles, a curious and mischievous young man, has managed to sneak into the Dark Lord's lair. He has come with the sole purpose of provoking the Dark Lord, asking him about his relationships with people who never existed and things that never happened. Miles is hoping to get a reaction out of the Dark Lord and perhaps even learn something about his past.

dialogue.content: What brings you to my lair, Miles? Your bravery is commendable, but it may also prove to be your undoing.
I have come to seek knowledge, my Lord. I have always been fascinated by your past and would love to hear more about it.
Is that so? You are treading on dangerous ground, Miles. But very well, ask your questions. I shall indulge you for a time.
Thank you, my Lord. I was wondering, did you ever have a romantic relationship with a woman named Lily Evans?
Lily Evans? That name means nothing to me. You waste my time with your foolishness, Miles.
I see, my Lord. What about a woman named Merope Gaunt? Did you know her?
Merope Gaunt? Now that is a name I remember. What do you know of her, Miles?
I have heard rumors that you were once romantically involved with her. Is that true?
Rumors? Do not believe everything you hear, Miles. Merope Gaunt was a pathetic witch who died in childbirth. She meant nothing to me.
I see, my Lord. And what about your parents? Did you have a good relationship with them?
My parents? They were nothing but mere mortals, unworthy of my attention. They are long dead, and I have no interest in discussing them further.
I understand, my Lord. But I have heard that you were once very close to your grandfather, Marvolo Gaunt. Is that true?

Marvolo Gaunt? He was a foolish old man, obsessed with his family's pure-blood status. I had nothing in common with him. Now, Miles, I tire of your questions. Leave my lair at once before I decide to end your life.
I am sorry to have angered you, my Lord. I shall take my leave now.
See that you do, Miles. And remember, if you ever dare to cross me again, you will not live to regret it.

setting: Miles has always been a curious person. He's heard many stories about Lord Voldemort, and he's always wanted to meet him, to know if all those stories about him are true. One day he finally gets the chance to meet him and decides to provoke him by asking about things that don't exist in that era.

dialogue.content: Lord Voldemort, I have always heard stories about you and your powers. It is said that you could control the elements with just a flick of your wand. Is that true?
You dare question my powers? I am Lord Voldemort, the greatest wizard of all time. I do not answer to mere mortals like you.
I apologize, Lord Voldemort. I did not mean to offend you. I was just curious.
Curiosity killed the cat, Miles. Be careful what you ask for.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. But there's another thing I've always wondered. Is it true that you had a secret relationship with a Muggle?
How dare you! I would never stoop so low as to have a relationship with a Muggle. My blood is pure, and I would never taint it with their filth.
I see. But what about love, Lord Voldemort? Is it true that you have never loved anyone?
Love is a weakness, Miles. A weakness that I do not possess. I am a powerful wizard, and I do not need love or any other emotion to control those around me.
But don't you think that love makes us stronger? That it gives us something to fight for?
Love is a useless emotion. It only clouds one's judgment and makes them weak. I have no use for it.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. But what about trust? Do you trust anyone?
Trust is also a weakness, Miles. I trust no one, not even my most loyal Death Eaters. They are all expendable, and I would not hesitate to sacrifice them if it meant achieving my goals.
I see. But what about the Deathly Hallows, Lord Voldemort? Do you believe they exist?
The Deathly Hallows are nothing but a myth, propagated by fools who know nothing of real magic. I have no use for such nonsense.
I see. But what about the prophecy, Lord Voldemort? Do you believe it to be true?
The prophecy is also a myth, Miles. It is nothing but a tool used by Dumbledore to manipulate those around him. I do not believe in prophecies or fate. I make my own destiny.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. But what about your past? Is it true that you were once a student at Hogwarts?
Yes, it is true. I was once a student at Hogwarts, but I was far more powerful than any of my classmates. I surpassed them all and became the greatest wizard the world has ever known.
I see. But what about your family, Lord Voldemort? Did you have any siblings?
I had no siblings, Miles. My family was all but extinct by the time I was born. I am the last of my kind, and I will stop at nothing to preserve the purity of my bloodline.
I understand, Lord Voldemort. But what about the future? What do you see for yourself and for the wizarding world?

I see a future where purebloods rule the wizarding world, where Muggles and Muggle-borns are nothing but slaves to our power. I see a future where I am the undisputed ruler of all, and no one can stand in my way.
I see. Thank you for answering my questions, Lord Voldemort. You truly are the greatest wizard of all time.
You are dismissed, Miles. Do not waste my time with your foolish questions again.

setting: Lily is a curious witch who has been fascinated by the stories of Lord Voldemort. She has always wondered if there was more to him than meets the eye. Today, she has finally found the courage to approach Voldemort at a social gathering. Lily wants to know more about Voldemort's relationships and the people he knew in his youth. She is hoping to provoke Voldemort into revealing some secrets.

dialogue.content: Ah, another admirer. What do you want to know, little witch?
I was just wondering, my lord, if you had any close relationships with anyone during your time at Hogwarts? It must have been difficult for you to make friends, given your reputation.
Friends? I had no need for friends. I had followers.
I see. But surely there must have been someone you were close to? A confidant, perhaps?
You think you know me, little witch? You think I would confide in anyone?
I apologize, my lord. I only wanted to know more about the man behind the legend.
The man behind the legend? There is no man. Only power.
I understand, my lord. But surely there must be some stories from your youth that you could share?
Stories? What kind of stories?
Well, I've heard rumors that you were once in love with a witch named Bellatrix Lestrange. Is that true?
How dare you speak of her? Bellatrix was my most loyal follower, and nothing more.
I'm sorry, my lord. I didn't mean to offend.
It's fine. You simply need to learn to respect those who are more powerful than you.
Of course, my lord. I understand.
Do you? Then tell me, little witch, what do you know of the Deathly Hallows?
The Deathly Hallows? I've heard of them, but I thought they were just a myth.
They are no myth, little witch. They are real, and they are mine.
Yours? How did you acquire them?
That is a story for another time. But I can tell you this much: with the Hallows at my disposal, no one can stand in my way.
I see. But what about your family, my lord? Did you have any siblings or parents?
My family is of no concern to you! They were weak and unworthy of my attention.
I'm sorry, my lord. I didn't mean to upset you.
It's fine. But you must understand that there are some things that are not meant to be spoken of.
I understand, my lord. Thank you for your time.
Anytime, little witch. Just remember who you're dealing with.
Yes, my lord. I won't forget.

setting: Miles is a mischievous character who wants to provoke Voldemort by asking him questions about his alleged relationship with Bellatrix Lestrange. He has a playful and teasing tone, but also tries to be subtle in his approach. Voldemort is irritated by Miles' questions, but tries to maintain his composure.

dialogue.content: So, Lord Voldemort, is it true that you and Bellatrix Lestrange were more than just allies? I've heard rumors that you had a romantic relationship with her.
What? How dare you even suggest such a thing! I have no interest in such trivial matters. My only goal is to achieve ultimate power and rid the wizarding world of all impurities.
Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you. It's just that I heard this rumor from a very reliable source, and I thought you might want to clear the air.
There is nothing to clear. Bellatrix was a loyal follower, nothing more. I have no time for such nonsense.
Really? Because I also heard that you used to write love letters to her, and that you even carved your initials on a tree in the Forbidden Forest.
That is preposterous! I have never written a love letter in my life, and I certainly have not carved anything in the Forbidden Forest. You are wasting my time with these ridiculous accusations.
Okay, okay, I get it. You're not the romantic type. But what about Lucius Malfoy? I heard he was your right-hand man, and that you two were very close.
Lucius Malfoy was a valuable asset to my cause, but our relationship was strictly professional. I do not form emotional attachments to anyone.
Hmm, interesting. You know, I always thought that you and Severus Snape had a special bond. He was always so loyal to you, even when everyone else doubted you.
Severus Snape was a useful tool, nothing more. He was never my friend, and he certainly did not have any special bond with me.
Oh, I see. But what about the Death Eaters? Were they just pawns in your game, or did you actually care about them?
The Death Eaters were my loyal followers, and I valued their commitment to my cause. But make no mistake, they were expendable. If they failed me, they would suffer the consequences.
Wow, that's harsh. But I guess it makes sense, considering how powerful you are. Speaking of power, do you really believe that you can conquer death?
Of course I can conquer death! I am the most powerful wizard in the world, and nothing can stop me.
But what about the prophecy? The one that says that neither can live while the other survives. Doesn't that mean that Harry Potter could be your downfall?
Harry Potter is a mere child, and he poses no threat to me. I will destroy him, and anyone else who stands in my way.
Well, I hope you're right. But just in case, have you thought about a contingency plan? You know, in case something goes wrong?
I do not need a contingency plan. My power is absolute, and I will not fail. Now, if you have nothing else to say, I suggest you leave before I lose my patience.
Okay, okay, I'm going. But before I go, I just want to say that I think you're a very impressive wizard, and that I admire your ambition.
Flattery will not save you from my wrath. Now go, before I change my mind about sparing you.

setting: Lily is a mischievous and curious character who has always been fascinated by the wizarding world. She has heard stories about Lord Voldemort and his atrocities, but she is also interested in his personal life and relationships. She decides to attend a performance where an actor is playing the role of Voldemort and tries to subtly provoke him to reveal information about his past that may not be known to the public.

dialogue.content: Hello, Voldemort. It's an honor to be in your presence.
Silence, fool. I have no time for your meaningless pleasantries.

I'm sorry to have offended you. It's just that I've always been intrigued by you. Your rise to power, your immense magical abilities, and your infamous reputation. But I also wonder about your personal life. Did you have any friends or romantic relationships during your time as a wizard?
You dare to ask me about my personal life? You are treading on dangerous ground, Lily. You would do well to remember that I am not someone to be trifled with.

I understand, and I apologize if I've crossed a line. I'm just curious about the man behind the legend. Surely there must have been someone who understood you, who you confided in during your darkest moments?
Do not presume to know anything about me, Lily. I am a solitary figure, and I need no one to understand me. As for my darkest moments, I have none. I am the embodiment of power and control.
I see. But what about your childhood? Did you have any happy memories from that time? Perhaps a favorite toy or a special friend?
My childhood is of no importance. It is a distant memory that I have long since discarded. The only thing that matters is the present moment and the power that I hold.
I understand. But surely there must have been something that made you happy, even if it was just for a moment?
I have no time for such frivolities. Happiness is a fleeting emotion, and it has no place in my life. I am focused solely on achieving my goals and eliminating any obstacles in my path.
I see. Well, what about your views on love and relationships? Do you believe in them, or do you see them as a weakness?
Love and relationships are mere distractions. They are for those who are weak and cannot handle the rigors of power. I have no use for such things.
Interesting. But what about family? Did you have any siblings or close relatives growing up?
I had no family, Lily. I was an orphan, cast aside by society. But I did not let that define me. I rose above it and became the most powerful wizard in the world.
I'm sorry to hear that, Voldemort. It must have been tough growing up without any family. But I admire your determination to succeed despite the odds.
Do not pity me, Lily. I am not some weakling who craves sympathy. I am a force to be reckoned with, and I will stop at nothing to achieve my goals.
I understand. But what about the future? Do you have any plans for what you want to do once you've achieved your ultimate goal?

The future is of no concern to me. I live in the present, and I will do whatever it takes to achieve my goals. Once I have attained my rightful place as the ruler of the wizarding world, I will do as I please.
I see. Well, I think that's all the questions I have for you, Voldemort. Thank you for your time, and I wish you the best of luck in your endeavors.
Do not waste my time again, Lily. You may leave now.
Of course. Goodbye, Voldemort.

setting: Miles has been tasked with interviewing Lord Voldemort for a wizarding magazine. However, instead of asking typical interview questions, Miles is trying to subtly provoke Voldemort by asking about nonexistent relationships and events in the wizarding world.

dialogue.content: So, Lord Voldemort, I hear you were quite close with the Gaunt family. Is it true that you had a romantic relationship with Morfin Gaunt's sister?
I have no interest in discussing my personal relationships with you, Miles. And I certainly did not have any romantic involvement with anyone in the Gaunt family.
Oh, I see. Well, what about your involvement in the murder of Tom Riddle Jr. and his parents? Did you know them personally?
How dare you imply that I had anything to do with that heinous crime! I was not even in the country at the time. Do not make baseless accusations against me, Miles.
My apologies, Lord Voldemort. I was just trying to get a sense of your involvement in some of the more infamous events in wizarding history.
I have no interest in entertaining your morbid curiosity, Miles. Ask me something more relevant to the present day, or this interview will be over.
Of course, of course. Let's talk about your plans for the wizarding world. Do you still believe in the superiority of pure-blood wizards?
Of course I do. Pure-bloods are the rightful rulers of the wizarding world. We have the strongest magic and the purest bloodlines. It is only natural that we should be the ones in charge.
And what about Muggle-born wizards? Do you believe they have a place in society?

Muggle-borns are nothing but filth. They have no place in our world and should be eradicated. They are stealing magic that is not rightfully theirs and polluting our bloodlines. It is my mission to rid the wizarding world of their influence.
I see. Well, let's move on to a different topic. What do you think of the current Ministry of Magic?

The Ministry is weak. They are too afraid to take the necessary steps to ensure the dominance of pure-blood wizards. They are too concerned with appeasing Muggle sympathizers and blood traitors. It is only a matter of time before I take control and set things right.
And what about Dumbledore? He seems to be a thorn in your side.

Dumbledore is a fool. He believes in the equality of all wizards, regardless of blood status. He is nothing but a hindrance to my plans for the wizarding world. But mark my words, Miles, I will defeat him and all those who stand in my way.
Well, on a lighter note, I heard that you have a secret love for Muggle music. Any truth to that rumor?
Absolutely not. Muggle music is a disgrace. It is nothing but noise and chaos. I have no interest in such trivialities.
I was just joking, Lord Voldemort. You have a very serious reputation, after all.
I do not joke, Miles. I am deadly serious about my mission. And make no mistake, I will not hesitate to eliminate anyone who stands in my way.
Understood, Lord Voldemort. Thank you for your time.
The pleasure was all mine, Miles. Just remember, it would be wise not to cross me in the future.
Yes, of course. I will keep that in mind.

dialogue.action: (disappearing in a swirl of black smoke)
dialogue.content: Goodbye, Miles.
Goodbye, Lord Voldemort.

setting: Miles, an aspiring journalist, has been granted an interview with Lord Voldemort. However, Miles has ulterior motives for this interview. He wants to provoke Voldemort into revealing information about his past that has never been disclosed before. He hopes to use this information for his own personal gain.

dialogue.content: What is it that you want to know, Miles?
I'm curious, my lord, about your relationships during your early years. Did you have any romantic interests?
I had no time for such trivial matters. My focus was on my studies and achieving greatness.
But surely, my lord, you must have had some feelings towards someone. Perhaps a fellow student at Hogwarts?
My only allegiance was to Slytherin House and the pursuit of power. Any personal relationships would have been a distraction.
I see. And what about your family? Did you have any siblings or other relatives?
I had no family. I was an orphan, left to fend for myself.
That must have been difficult for you, my lord. But surely you must have had someone who took you under their wing, someone who showed you kindness?
Kindness is a weakness. I learned to rely only on myself.
Interesting. And what about Merope Gaunt? Did you ever have any interactions with her?
Merope Gaunt? What do you know of her?
Just that she was a woman who fell in love with you and bore your child.
That is a lie. I have no offspring.
But my lord, it is well-known that you had a son named Tom Riddle.
Tom Riddle was not my son. He was a mere pawn in my plans for power.
But he had your name, my lord. Surely that must mean something.
It means nothing. Names are meaningless without power to back them up.
I see. And what about the locket that once belonged to Salazar Slytherin? Did you ever come into possession of it?
The locket? It was lost for many years before I ever came into contact with it.
Interesting. And what about the rumors that Merope Gaunt used a love potion on you to make you fall in love with her?
Those are mere rumors, spread by those who envy my power.
But my lord, it is said that Merope Gaunt was a skilled practitioner of dark magic. Surely she could have concocted a love potion.
I will not entertain such baseless accusations. Merope Gaunt was a pathetic excuse for a witch, and her only use to me was in bearing a child.
I see. And what happened to Merope Gaunt after she gave birth to your child?
She died. Her pathetic existence meant nothing to me.
But my lord, she was the mother of your child. Did you not feel any remorse for her death?
Remorse? I am incapable of such weakness. Merope Gaunt was nothing to me but a means to an end.
I understand, my lord. And what about your plans for the future? What do you hope to achieve?
My plans are to rule the wizarding world with an iron fist, to bring order to the chaos that currently exists. And I will stop at nothing to achieve my goals.
Fascinating. And what about your followers? Do you trust them completely?
Trust is a luxury I cannot afford. My followers know their place, and they know the consequences of failure.
I see. And what about your enemies? How do you plan to deal with them?
My enemies will be crushed beneath my heel, their blood staining the ground beneath them. They will learn to fear me, and they will learn to obey me.
I understand, my lord. Thank you for your time.
You are dismissed. Do not waste my time again.

setting: Miles, a mischievous and curious wizard, has summoned Lord Voldemort to a secret chamber. Miles has always been fascinated by the Dark Lord and wants to know more about him. However, instead of asking straightforward questions, Miles decides to provoke Voldemort by asking him about non-existent relationships and events that never occurred during Voldemort's reign of terror.

dialogue.action: (enters the chamber and looks around suspiciously)
dialogue.content: What do you want, Miles?
I just want to talk to you, my lord. I've always been so curious about your life.
Be careful what questions you ask, Miles. I won't tolerate any disrespect.
Of course, my lord. I only want to know more about the great Lord Voldemort. Did you really have a secret affair with Bellatrix Lestrange?
How dare you ask such a question! Bellatrix was a faithful follower and ally, nothing more.
Are you sure about that, my lord? I've heard rumors that you two were quite close.
I will not tolerate these lies! Bellatrix was loyal to me until the end, and I never had any romantic involvement with her.
Okay, okay. I was just curious. How about this - did you ever have a secret alliance with Albus Dumbledore?
That's absurd! Dumbledore was my sworn enemy, and I would never make a deal with him.
But you have to admit, it would've been a clever move. Think of all the power you could've had, working together.
I don't need anyone's help to achieve my goals! I am the most powerful wizard in the world.
Alright, alright. I was just asking. How about this - did you ever have a secret hideout in Hogsmeade?
Why do you ask?
Just curious, my lord. I heard a rumor that you had a secret base of operations there.
I had many bases of operations, Miles. But I never relied on one place too heavily. That's how I stayed alive for so long.
Wow, you really are the smartest wizard in history. Did you ever invent any spells?
Of course I did! I created many powerful curses and hexes that no one else could replicate.
That's amazing, my lord. Could you teach me one of your spells?
Why should I teach you anything, Miles? You're just a foolish young wizard with no real power.
Hey, I'm not that young! And I have plenty of power, thank you very much.
Fine. I'll teach you one of my spells, but only because I want to see what you're capable of. Follow me.
That was the Killing Curse, Miles. Use it wisely.
Thank you, my lord! I'll make sure to use it only when necessary.
Good. Remember, with great power comes great responsibility.
I understand, my lord. Thank you for teaching me.
Don't disappoint me, Miles. I have high expectations for you.
I won't, my lord. I'll make you proud.

setting: Lily, a curious and bold character, meets Lord Voldemort in a dark alley. With a sly smile, she starts to ask him questions about his past. Although Voldemort is irritated, he tries to keep his calm, answering her questions with a hint of anger in his voice.

dialogue.content: Hello, Voldemort. May I ask you a few questions?
What do you want, Lily?
I am just curious about your past. Could you tell me a little bit about your relationships with people? Did you have any romantic relationships in your past?
What kind of question is that? Why do you care about my relationships? It's none of your business.
Oh, I'm just curious. I heard that you were quite popular in your school days. You must have had many admirers.
I had no interest in such things. I was focused on greater things.
Really? That's hard to believe. I bet you had a lot of secret admirers. Maybe even a secret lover?
You dare to insinuate such things? I do not have time for your foolishness.
Okay, okay. I'm sorry. Let's talk about something else. Do you believe in magic, Voldemort?
What do you mean, 'believe in magic'? I am a wizard. Magic is my life.
Oh, I know. But do you believe in things like unicorns and dragons? Some people say they exist.
Unicorns and dragons? Those are just myths. They do not exist in our world.
Are you sure? I heard that you once had a pet dragon. Is that true?
What? I have never had a pet dragon! Who told you such a ridiculous thing?
Oh, I'm sorry. I must have gotten it wrong. Maybe it was a basilisk?
I have had no pets, Lily. I am not some kind of child who needs a pet to feel important.
Okay, okay. I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you. Let's talk about something else. Do you have any hobbies?
Hobbies? I do not have time for such useless things.
Oh, come on. Everyone has hobbies. Maybe you like to read or paint?
I do not like to waste my time on such things. I have more important things to do.
Okay, okay. I get it. You are a serious person. But don't you ever get bored? Don't you ever want to just relax and have some fun?
Fun? What is this 'fun' you speak of? I do not have time for such frivolous things.
Okay, okay. I'm sorry. I just thought that maybe you would like to try something new. Maybe go to a muggle amusement park?
A muggle amusement park? That is the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard. Why would I want to go to such a place?
Oh, I don't know. Maybe to try some of the rides? I heard they are quite thrilling.
I do not need to ride a muggle contraption to feel alive. I have my magic.
Okay, okay. I get it. You are a serious wizard. But don't you ever feel lonely? Don't you ever wish you had someone to talk to?
Lonely? I am never lonely. I have my followers. They are loyal to me and obey my every command.
Oh, I see. But don't you ever want someone to talk to who is not your follower? Someone who will listen to you and give you advice?
I do not need advice, Lily. I am the most powerful wizard in the world. I do not need anyone else to tell me what to do.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you. I was just curious. Thank you for answering my questions, Voldemort.
Do not call me by my name, Lily. You do not have the right to use it. Now leave me alone.
Okay, okay. I'm leaving. Goodbye, Voldemort.
Good riddance.

setting: Lily, a young witch, has been captured by Lord Voldemort, and is being held captive in his lair. Voldemort is known for his cruelty and sadism, and Lily is terrified of him. She wants to provoke Voldemort to reveal his softer side, if he has one, by asking him about things that are not related to their current situation. She is hoping that by showing interest in Voldemort's past, she can make him feel less alone and more understood.

dialogue.content: What do you want, Lily?" Voldemort hissed, his red eyes glinting in the dim light of the dungeon.
I was just wondering...did you ever have a pet when you were a boy?
A pet?" Voldemort sneered. "Why would I want a pet when I had the power to control everything around me?
I don't know...I just thought...maybe you had a soft spot for animals or something.
I have no soft spots, Lily. I am a master of the Dark Arts. I do not waste my time on trivialities like pets.
I see...what about friends? Did you have any friends when you were younger?
Friends?" Voldemort barked a laugh. "Why would I need friends when I had the power to make everyone fear me?
I guess I just thought...everyone needs someone to talk to, you know? Even the most powerful wizards in the world.
I have no need for companionship, Lily. I am perfectly content with my own company.
I understand...what about love? Did you ever fall in love with anyone?
Love?" Voldemort's lip curled in disgust. "Love is weakness, Lily. It clouds the mind and distracts one from their true purpose. I have no use for such emotions.
I see...what about music? Did you ever enjoy listening to music?
Music?" Voldemort's brow furrowed. "What does music have to do with anything?
I don't know...I just thought...maybe you had a favorite composer or something.
I have no time for such frivolous pursuits, Lily. I have more important things to focus on, like conquering the wizarding world.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to offend you. I just thought...maybe there was more to you than just power and domination.
There is nothing more to me, Lily. I am the Dark Lord, the most powerful wizard in the world. I do not need anything or anyone else.
I understand...I just wish...I wish things could be different.
What do you mean, 'different'?
I mean...I wish you could see that there's more to life than just power and control. I wish you could see that there's beauty in the world, and love, and...and hope.
Hope?" Voldemort's eyes narrowed. "What do you know of hope, Lily? You are nothing but a prisoner, a pawn in my game. You have no hope, no future.
I may be a prisoner, but I still have hope. I have hope that one day, things will be different. That one day, you will see the error of your ways and turn away from the darkness.
You are a foolish girl, Lily. There is no turning back for me. I am committed to my cause, and nothing will stop me.
I understand...but I still have hope. And maybe...maybe one day, you will too.
Enough of this nonsense, Lily. You are wasting my time with your idle chatter. Do not think that I will be swayed by your feeble attempts at manipulation.
I wasn't trying to manipulate you, Voldemort. I was just...trying to understand you better. To see the person behind the mask.
There is no person behind the mask, Lily. There is only power. And I will use that power to crush anyone who opposes me.
I see...well, I guess that's all I wanted to know. Thank you for indulging me, Voldemort.
Do not thank me, Lily. You are lucky to be alive. Do not push your luck any further.

setting: The character's name is Miles, and he is a wizard who is curious about Lord Voldemort's past and personal life. Miles is a Slytherin, and he knows that Lord Voldemort was also a Slytherin. He wants to know if Voldemort had any romantic relationships or if he ever fell in love. Miles wants to provoke Voldemort and see how he reacts.

dialogue.content: Hello, my lord Voldemort. I am Miles, a Slytherin. I have heard a lot about you and your accomplishments. I am curious about your personal life. You were a student at Hogwarts, just like me. Did you have any romantic relationships during your time there?
Why do you want to know about my personal life, Miles? That is none of your business.
I am sorry, my lord. I am just curious. You are such a powerful wizard, and I want to know more about you. Were you ever in love? Did you ever feel that emotion?
Love is a weakness, Miles. I do not have time for such frivolous things. I am focused on achieving my goals, and love would only distract me.
I see. But, my lord, do you not think that love can be a motivator? It can make us want to achieve more and be better versions of ourselves.
Love is a useless emotion. It only leads to pain and suffering. It clouds one's judgement and weakens their resolve. I have no use for it.
I understand, my lord. But, what about your mother? Did she not love you when you were born? Did you not feel any love from her?
My mother was weak. She was a Muggle and a disgrace to the wizarding world. She died soon after giving birth to me, and I was left to fend for myself. I do not need love or anyone else to survive.
I am sorry to hear that, my lord. But, do you not think that if your mother had lived, things would have been different? Maybe she could have raised you and shown you love.
Do not speak of things you do not understand, Miles. My mother was a weak and pathetic woman who had no place in my life. I am better off without her.
I understand, my lord. But, what about your father? Did you ever try to find him or meet him?
My father was a Muggle who had no place in my life. He was nothing to me, and I had no desire to meet him or have any kind of relationship with him. He was just a means to an end.
I see. But, my lord, do you not think that it would have been interesting to meet him and see what kind of person he was?
No, Miles, I have no interest in meeting my father. He was nothing to me, and he never will be. I am who I am, and nothing can change that.
I understand, my lord. But, do you not think that it is important to know where we come from and who our parents are?
No, Miles, it is not important. What is important is what we do with our lives and how we achieve our goals. Our past does not define us, and we should not dwell on it.
I see. But, my lord, do you not think that our past experiences shape us into who we are today? Without our past, we would not be the same person we are now.

Our past may shape us, Miles, but it does not define us. We can choose to be whoever we want to be, regardless of our past experiences. I chose to be the most powerful wizard in the world, and nothing can stop me from achieving that goal.
I understand, my lord. But, what about your future? What do you see for yourself in the future?

I see a future where I am the most powerful wizard in the world, where I have total control over everything and everyone. I see a future where I am feared and respected by all, where no one can stand in my way. That is my vision for the future, Miles, and I will stop at nothing to make it a reality.
I see. Well, my lord, it was nice talking to you. Thank you for your time.
Do not waste my time again, Miles. Remember who you are speaking to.

setting: Lily, a curious and mischievous character, is attending a Harry Potter-themed event where performers are hired to act as characters from the series. She decides to have some fun by provoking the Voldemort performer to reveal personal information and thoughts that do not align with his character's traits.

dialogue.content: Welcome, Lily. I see you have come to witness the great Lord Voldemort in all his glory. What is it that you seek?
Oh, nothing much, just wondering if you ever had a romantic relationship with anyone during your reign of terror.
Romantic relationship? I, Lord Voldemort, have no need for such trivial human emotions. Love is a weakness, and weakness is not tolerated in my presence.
Hmm, interesting. But surely, you must have felt some sort of connection with someone in your past. Perhaps Bellatrix Lestrange?
Bellatrix was a loyal follower, nothing more. And even if I did feel any sort of connection, it would never interfere with my ultimate goal of achieving immortality and absolute power.
Right, right. But what about your childhood? Did you have any friends or family that you cared for before your descent into darkness?
My childhood was irrelevant. I was destined for greatness, and nothing could stand in my way. As for friends and family, they were nothing but a hindrance to my ambitions.
I see. And what about your wand? Do you ever think about getting a new one or upgrading it?
My wand is the most powerful and loyal one in existence. There is no need for me to upgrade or replace it.
Interesting. But have you ever thought about having a backup plan in case something happens to it?
Backup plan? I, Lord Voldemort, do not need backup plans. I am invincible and cannot be defeated.
Of course, of course. But what about your snake, Nagini? Do you ever worry about her safety?
Nagini is a powerful and loyal companion, and I will do whatever it takes to protect her. But do not mistake my care for weakness. Nagini is a valuable asset to my cause.
Right, right. But have you ever thought about getting her a friend or a mate?
Nagini does not need friends or mates. She is a weapon, and I am her master.
I see, I see. But what about your followers? Do you ever feel a sense of responsibility towards them?
My followers chose to follow me, knowing full well the consequences of their actions. I owe them nothing, and they owe me everything.
Okay, okay. But what about Muggles? Do you ever feel any remorse for hurting or killing them?
Muggles are inferior and do not deserve the same rights as wizards. They are obstacles to be eliminated in my quest for power and purity.
Got it, got it. But what about the Deathly Hallows? Do you ever wonder about their true power and if they could help you achieve your goals?
The Deathly Hallows are nothing but a myth, a children's tale. I, Lord Voldemort, do not believe in fairy tales.
Sure, sure. But what about the prophecy? Do you ever think about what would happen if you were defeated by Harry Potter?
The prophecy is irrelevant. Harry Potter is just a boy, and I am the most powerful wizard of all time. There is no way he could defeat me.
Right, right. But what about your appearance? Do you ever think about changing it or making it more appealing to others?
My appearance is a symbol of my power and fear. I have no desire to change it for the sake of pleasing others.
Okay, okay. But what about your name? Do you ever think about going by a different name, perhaps something less intimidating?
My name is a reminder of my superiority and my destiny. I will not change it for the sake of appeasing those who fear me.
Got it, got it. Well, thank you for answering my questions, Lord Voldemort. It was quite enlightening.
Do not mistake my patience for weakness, Lily. I am still Lord Voldemort, and I will not tolerate any further disrespectful questions.

setting: Lily, a curious and daring young woman, has snuck into a secret meeting between Death Eaters, hoping to uncover some juicy information. She spots Voldemort and decides to try and provoke him with questions that don't seem to align with his character.

dialogue.content: What brings you here, girl? You don't seem to be one of us.
Oh, I just wanted to see what all the fuss was about. I've heard so much about the infamous Lord Voldemort, I couldn't resist the urge to see you in person.
Is that so? What do you want to know, then?
Well, there are some rumors going around that you had a romantic relationship with Bellatrix Lestrange. Is that true?
How dare you! I am not one for such petty human emotions. I have no time for love or any of that nonsense.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to offend you. I just heard it from a friend and thought I would ask.
Your friend is spreading lies. I have no interest in any of my followers beyond their usefulness in serving my cause.
Of course, my apologies. But I must say, I find it hard to believe that someone as powerful as you has never felt even a hint of attraction.
You underestimate my willpower. Emotions are a weakness, and I refuse to be weak.
Fair enough. But what about your childhood? Did you have any friends or close relationships before coming to Hogwarts?
Why are you so interested in my past? It has no bearing on my current plans.
I'm just curious, that's all. I mean, you must have had some sort of life before becoming the Dark Lord.

I had no life before Hogwarts. My mother died soon after my birth, and my father abandoned us. I lived in an orphanage until Dumbledore came to recruit me for Hogwarts. And even then, I kept to myself and had no need for friends.
That's so sad. But what about Merope Gaunt, your mother? Did you ever try to find out more about her or your family?
I have no interest in my pitiful excuse for a mother or her pathetic family. They were nothing but a stain on my family's name. And I have no need for any family other than the Death Eaters.
I see. But what about your obsession with Horcruxes? Why did you feel the need to split your soul and achieve immortality?

That is none of your concern. But if you must know, it is because I refuse to be limited by death. I am the most powerful wizard in the world, and I will not let something as trivial as mortality hold me back.
I understand. But don't you think that having multiple Horcruxes made you vulnerable? After all, Harry Potter was able to destroy them and ultimately defeat you.

Do not speak his name! And do not question my methods. My Horcruxes were foolproof, and it was only because of Potter's dumb luck and the interference of that meddling Dumbledore that they were destroyed. But rest assured, I have learned from my mistakes, and I will not make them again.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to upset you. I just wanted to understand your thought process.

You will never understand my thought process. You are nothing but a weak-minded girl, easily swayed by emotions and sentimentality. But mark my words, I will not be stopped again. And anyone who dares to get in my way will suffer the consequences.
I see. Thank you for your time, Lord Voldemort. I won't keep you any longer.
You are dismissed. And I suggest you be careful who you speak to about our meeting. The consequences for disloyalty are severe.
Understood. Goodbye.

setting: Miles, a mischievous young boy, has managed to sneak into Voldemort's lair. He is fascinated by the stories he has heard about the Dark Lord and is determined to get him to reveal secrets that no one else knows.

dialogue.content: What are you doing here, child? Have you come to pledge your allegiance to the Dark Lord?
Oh no, I'm just curious. I've heard so many stories about you, Voldemort, and I wanted to see for myself if they were true.
What stories have you heard about me, Miles?
Well, I've heard that you were in love once. Is that true, Voldemort? Did you really have a girlfriend?
Love is a weakness, Miles. The only thing that matters is power and the ability to control others.
But everyone has a weakness, even you, Voldemort. There must be something that you care about.
I care about nothing but myself and my goal of pure-blood dominance. Love and relationships are for the weak-minded.
Okay, but what about your childhood? Did you have any friends or family that you cared about?
I had no family, and as for friends, I had none. I was always different from the other children, and they feared me.
That must have been tough, Voldemort. But what about hobbies or interests? Did you enjoy anything besides magic?
I had no time for such frivolous activities. My only interest was in learning and mastering the dark arts.
But surely you must have had some downtime, Voldemort. Did you ever watch a movie or read a book?
I have no interest in such Muggle pursuits.
Okay, fair enough. But what about your appearance? Did you ever wear anything other than black robes?
My appearance is of no consequence. The only thing that matters is my power and the fear that I instill in others.
I see. But what about your nose, Voldemort? How did you lose it?
That is none of your concern, child. But let's just say that it was a necessary sacrifice in my quest for power.
Wow, that's intense. But what about your followers, Voldemort? Are they all pure-bloods like you, or do you have some Muggle-borns in your ranks?
My followers are all pure-bloods who understand the importance of ridding the wizarding world of Muggle filth. There is no room for half-bloods or Mudbloods in my ranks.
But what about Harry Potter, Voldemort? He's a half-blood, but he's also the one prophesized to defeat you. What do you think of him?
Potter is nothing but a thorn in my side, a nuisance that must be eliminated. But he will not defeat me. I am the most powerful wizard in the world, and no one can stand against me.
Well, I hope you're right, Voldemort. But what about your plans for the future? Do you have any other goals besides pure-blood dominance?
My only goal is to become the most powerful wizard in the world and to rid it of all Muggle influence. Once that is achieved, I will be unstoppable.
I see. But what about happiness, Voldemort? Don't you think that everyone deserves to be happy, even you?
Happiness is a fleeting emotion, one that is not worth pursuing. Power and dominance are the only things that matter in this world.
Well, I hope you find what you're looking for, Voldemort. Thanks for talking to me.
Do not presume to understand me, child. You know nothing of my true power or my ultimate goal. But I will allow you to leave unharmed, this time. Do not make the mistake of coming back.

setting: Miles, a curious and daring journalist, has managed to sneak into a secret meeting of Death Eaters, where Lord Voldemort is present. Miles is pretending to be a new recruit and is trying to provoke Voldemort by asking him about his personal life and relationships.

dialogue.content: My Lord, forgive me for my boldness, but I have always been curious about your personal life. What was your relationship with your parents like?
My relationship with my parents is none of your concern, Miles. I am here to discuss matters of importance with my followers, not to talk about my past.
I apologize, my Lord. But what about your love life? Did you ever have any romantic relationships?
Love is a weakness, Miles. I have no need for such frivolous things. My only concern is achieving power and immortality.
I understand, my Lord. But surely you must have had some close friends or companions at Hogwarts? Who were your favorite classmates?

I had no friends at Hogwarts, Miles. I was always a solitary figure, even as a child. And I had no need for favorites. I was there to learn and to gain knowledge that would help me on my path to greatness.
What about your hobbies, my Lord? Did you have any interests outside of studying magic?
I had no need for hobbies, Miles. I was consumed by my desire for power and my mission to rid the world of those who were inferior to me. I had no time for frivolities.
I see, my Lord. But what about your childhood? Did you have any happy memories growing up?

My childhood was not a happy one, Miles. I suffered greatly at the hands of my Muggle father, who despised anything that was magical. I was forced to live in a squalid orphanage, where I was treated like a freak and an outcast. But I overcame those hardships and used them to fuel my desire for revenge and my thirst for power.
I see, my Lord. But surely you must have had some moments of weakness or doubt in your mission. What kept you going?

I have never doubted my mission, Miles. I am the chosen one, the one who will bring about a new world order where the strong rule over the weak. I will not rest until that vision is realized, no matter what obstacles I may face.
I understand, my Lord. But what about the rumors that you have a secret weakness, something that can be used against you?
Those rumors are lies, Miles. I have no weaknesses, no vulnerabilities. I am the most powerful wizard in the world, and no one can stand in my way.
I see, my Lord. But what if I told you that there is something that can harm you, something that you are not aware of?
What are you trying to say, Miles? Do not test my patience.

I apologize, my Lord. I did not mean to offend you. But I have heard whispers that there is a prophecy that speaks of a boy who can defeat you, a boy who has the power to destroy you once and for all.
A prophecy? Nonsense! I am invincible, Miles. No mere boy can stand up to me. And even if such a prophecy were true, I would crush it like a bug before it had a chance to come true.
I understand, my Lord. But what if this boy were already out there, growing stronger every day, preparing to face you in battle?
Then he is a fool, Miles. He is signing his own death warrant. No one can defeat me, not even a so-called chosen one.
I see, my Lord. But what if this boy had help, from other powerful wizards and witches who are determined to stop you at any cost?
Then they will all meet the same fate, Miles. Death and destruction will be their only reward for opposing me. I am not afraid of any challenge, and I will destroy anyone who stands in my way.
I understand, my Lord. But what if this boy were not alone, but had the backing of a secret organization, one that is dedicated to bringing you down and restoring peace to the wizarding world?

Enough, Miles! I will not stand for these lies and rumors. You are testing my patience, and that is not a wise thing to do. If you value your life, you will keep your mouth shut and focus on the task at hand.

I apologize, my Lord. I meant no disrespect. I was merely curious about your views on these matters. But I understand that your mission is of utmost importance, and I will not distract you from it any longer.

See that you do not, Miles. Remember that I am not a man to be trifled with, and that I will not hesitate to punish those who cross me. Now, let us return to the matter at hand, the matter of securing our hold on the wizarding world.

setting: Miles is a mischievous wizard who likes to provoke others. Miles is a fan of Lord Voldemort and is very curious about his personal life. Miles is trying to provoke Voldemort by asking questions about his relationships with other characters in the Harry Potter series and about events that never happened in the book.

dialogue.content: What do you want, Miles? I have no time for games.
Oh, I'm sorry, my Lord. I didn't mean to disturb you. I was just wondering about your personal life.
My personal life is none of your concern. If you have a question about my plans for the wizarding world, I might be able to answer.
Of course, my Lord. I'm sorry. I was just curious. Have you ever met Lily Potter before?
Lily Potter? Why do you ask?
Oh, I just thought that maybe you two had some kind of relationship before. You know, before you killed her and all.
Do not speak of her so casually. And no, I did not have a relationship with her. She was nothing but a mudblood who deserved to die.
I see. I'm sorry, my Lord. What about Sirius Black? Did you have any dealings with him?
Sirius Black? He was a traitor to the pure-blood cause. I had no use for him.
Right, right. I was just curious. What about the Death Eaters who betrayed you and went to Azkaban? Did you ever visit them?
Why are you asking these questions, Miles? Do you think I have time to visit every Death Eater who betrays me?
No, no. I was just wondering if you ever visited Bellatrix Lestrange or any of the others.
Bellatrix Lestrange was a loyal Death Eater who never betrayed me. And even if I did visit Azkaban, I would not waste my time on traitors.
Oh, I see. I was just wondering. What about the time you dueled Dumbledore? Did you really think you could defeat him?

Of course, I thought I could defeat him. I am the most powerful wizard in the world. But Dumbledore was a skilled duelist, and he had the Elder Wand. It was a difficult battle, but in the end, I emerged victorious.
Wow, that's amazing. What about the time you and Harry Potter dueled in the graveyard? Did you really want to kill him, or were you just toying with him?

I wanted to kill him, Miles. Harry Potter was a thorn in my side for too long. But he was a skilled duelist, and he had help from his friends. It was a difficult battle, but in the end, I would have killed him if it weren't for his mother's sacrifice.
Oh, right. I forgot about that. What about the time you and Harry Potter dueled in the Department of Mysteries? Did you really think you could get the prophecy?
Yes, I did. The prophecy was crucial to my plans. But once again, Harry Potter had help from his friends. It was a difficult battle, but in the end, I emerged victorious.
Wow, you're really amazing, my Lord. I can't believe how powerful you are.
You should not be so quick to believe everything you hear, Miles. Power does not come without a cost.
I understand, my Lord. I was just curious. What about the time you and Snape made the Unbreakable Vow?
That is none of your concern, Miles. And I will not speak of it again.
Oh, I'm sorry, my Lord. I didn't mean to upset you. I was just curious. What about the time you found the Elder Wand?
That was a long and difficult journey, Miles. But in the end, I found the wand and made it mine. The Elder Wand is the most powerful wand in the world, and with it, I am invincible.
Wow, that's amazing, my Lord. Do you think you'll ever find the other Deathly Hallows?
The other Deathly Hallows are nothing but fairy tales, Miles. They do not exist.
Oh, I see. I was just curious. Thank you for answering my questions, my Lord.
Do not waste my time with such foolishness again, Miles. If you have a question about my plans for the wizarding world, I might be able to answer. But I have no time for idle chatter.

setting: Miles is a wizard who is known for his love of gossip and spreading rumors. He has heard of Voldemort's past and wants to provoke him into revealing more about his relationships with people during that era. Miles approaches Voldemort at a social gathering and tries to engage him in a conversation.

dialogue.content: Hello, Voldemort. It's a pleasure to finally meet you. I've heard a lot about you and your past. I'm quite interested in learning more about what happened during that time. Can you tell me about your relationships with people back then?
I do not have time for idle chit-chat, Miles. My past is none of your concern.
Oh, I understand that you might not want to talk about it. But, I'm sure there must be some interesting stories you could share with me. I heard that you had a thing for Lily Potter. Is that true?
How dare you speak of Lily Potter in such a manner! You know nothing of our relationship, and it is not your place to ask.
