Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to offend you, Voldemort. But, I was just curious. I heard that you were quite close to her before she was killed.
My relationship with Lily Potter is none of your concern. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have more important matters to attend to.
I understand, Voldemort. But, please, just one more question. I heard that you had a secret relationship with Bellatrix Lestrange. Is that true?
I will not dignify that with a response. Bellatrix Lestrange is a loyal follower and a trusted confidant. Our relationship is not one that is up for discussion.
I see. Well, thank you for your time, Voldemort. It was a pleasure speaking with you.
Do not presume to speak of pleasure, Miles. Our conversation was far from enjoyable.

setting: Lily, a character, has come to meet Lord Voldemort. She is curious about the relationships that Voldemort might have had in the past. She wants to provoke him by asking him about unreal things that did not happen in that era.

dialogue.content: Hello, my Lord. It's an honor to meet you.
The pleasure is mine.
I've always been fascinated by history. I was wondering, my Lord, did you have any relationships with anyone during your time?
What kind of relationships are you talking about?
I mean, romantic relationships. Did you have anyone you loved during your time as a powerful wizard?
Love is a weakness, Lily. I have no use for it.
But don't you think everyone needs love at some point in their life?
No, I don't. Love is a distraction that can lead to vulnerability. As a powerful wizard, I cannot afford to be vulnerable.
I understand, my Lord. But don't you think it would have made your life more fulfilling?
I do not seek fulfillment, Lily. I seek power and domination.
I see. Well then, what about friendships? Did you have any close friends during your time?
Friends are a liability. They can be used against you. I prefer to keep my relationships strictly professional.
But my Lord, don't you think it's important to have someone you can confide in and trust?
Trust is a concept that I do not believe in, Lily. It is a weakness that can be exploited. And as for confiding in someone, I am my own confidant.
I understand, my Lord. But what about hobbies or interests? Did you have any during your time?
My only interest is in the Dark Arts, Lily. I have no time for trivial pursuits.
I see. Well then, what about the Death Eaters? Did you consider them to be your followers or your friends?
The Death Eaters are my loyal servants, Lily. They do not need to be my friends.
But don't you think it's important to have a connection with your followers? To understand them and their motivations?
I understand my followers perfectly, Lily. They are loyal to me because they fear me. And fear is the most powerful motivator.
I see. Well then, my Lord, did you have any enemies during your time?
I had many enemies, Lily. But they are all dead now.
What about the ones that got away? The ones that survived?
They will meet their end soon enough, Lily. No one can stand against me.
I understand, my Lord. But what about the ones that are still alive? Do you think they pose a threat to you?
No one poses a threat to me, Lily. I am invincible.
But my Lord, what about the prophecy? The one that said you would be defeated by a boy born at the end of July?
That prophecy was a lie, Lily. A desperate attempt by my enemies to bring me down. But they failed, as they always do.
But my Lord, Harry Potter did defeat you in the end. Doesn't that prove that the prophecy was true?
Harry Potter was lucky, Lily. Luck is a fickle thing, and it will not save him next time.
I see. Well then, my Lord, what about your plans for the future? What do you hope to achieve?
I hope to achieve complete domination, Lily. To rule over the wizarding world with an iron fist. And I will stop at nothing to achieve it.
I understand, my Lord. But don't you think that kind of power comes with a price? That it might be too much for one person to handle?
I am not just any person, Lily. I am the most powerful wizard that has ever lived. And nothing is too much for me to handle.
I understand, my Lord. I apologize if my questions have been too personal.
It is of no consequence, Lily. You are simply curious, and I do not fault you for that.
Thank you, my Lord. It has been an honor to speak with you.
The pleasure is mine, Lily.

setting: Miles, a Muggle-born wizard, has been captured by Voldemort and is being interrogated. Miles is trying to provoke Voldemort by asking questions about things that never happened or are not true. Miles is attempting to get information out of Voldemort by subtly provoking him. Voldemort is becoming increasingly irritated with Miles' questions.

dialogue.content: What do you want, Miles?
I just want to know more about your past, my lord. I've heard so many fascinating things about you.
What do you want to know?
Well, I've heard rumors that you had a romantic relationship with Bellatrix Lestrange. Is it true?
That is none of your concern, Miles. Bellatrix is a loyal follower and a valuable asset to me. Her personal life is not something I care about.
Of course, my lord. I was just curious. I've also heard that you were once a member of the Order of the Phoenix. Is that true?
Absurd. I have never been a member of that organization. They are my enemies.
I see. And what about your relationship with Harry Potter? Did you ever consider sparing him?
Harry Potter is my greatest enemy. He must be destroyed. There is no room for mercy in my world.
I understand, my lord. But what about your childhood? I've heard that you were once a rich and influential member of the Gaunt family. What happened to your family?
The Gaunts were a useless and pathetic family. They were obsessed with their pureblood lineage and their foolish beliefs. They were weak and foolish, and they deserved their fate.
But weren't you related to them?
I am the last descendant of Salazar Slytherin, through my mother's family, the Gaunts. But I have no love for them. They were nothing but a burden to me.
I see. And what about your wand? I've heard that it's made of phoenix feather. Is that true?
Yes, it is. And it is a powerful tool that has served me well. But why do you care about my wand?
Oh, I'm just curious. I heard that phoenix feather wands are very rare and valuable. I was wondering if you ever considered selling it.
Sell my wand? How dare you suggest such a thing! My wand is a part of me, a powerful tool that I will never part with. Do not speak of such things again, Miles.
I'm sorry, my lord. I didn't mean to offend you. I was just curious.
Curiosity can be a dangerous thing, Miles. You would do well to remember that.
Yes, my lord. I understand.
Good. Now, is there anything else you wish to know?
No, my lord. That's all for now.
Very well. You will remain here until I have need of you. Do not try to escape, Miles. The consequences would be severe.
Yes, my lord. I understand.
